dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, so we're seeing, like, vaccines really picking up speed now, especially in wealthier countries, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, so we're seeing, like, vaccines really picking up speed now, especially in wealthier countries, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vaccines will reach the majority of rich-country citizens in the first quarter of this year, and citizens of low- and lower-middle-income countries will also begin to access them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, absolutely. And it's not just the rich nations, which is, um, really thanks to this incredible global effort, specifically COVAX, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, absolutely. And it's not just the rich nations, which is, um, really thanks to this incredible global effort, specifically C O V A X, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The speed and scale at which vaccines are being provided is both extraordinary and necessary to end the pandemic, and is possible only thanks to an unprecedented show of global solidarity and multilateral support for COVAX, the central mechanism in the global COVID-19 vaccination effort...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, COVAX. I mean, it's pretty wild how quickly this came together, isn't it? Like, a central mechanism for global vaccination.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, C O V A X. I mean, it's pretty wild how quickly this came together, isn't it? Like, a central mechanism for global vaccination.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...COVAX, the central mechanism in the global COVID-19 vaccination effort, launched last year by the World Health Organization and Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance (which I led).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And it's aiming for a billion doses, reaching, uh, people in 190 countries, regardless of their ability to pay. Even hoping to cover all healthcare workers globally by mid-year. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And it's aiming for a billion doses, reaching, uh, people in one hundred ninety countries, regardless of their ability to pay. Even hoping to cover all healthcare workers globally by mid-year. That's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: COVAX will facilitate the rollout of two billion vaccine doses over the next year, reaching people in 190 participating countries and economies, regardless of their ability to pay.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, mid-year for all health workers? That's ambitious. I remember, um, there were definitely some naysayers early on, but it seems to be really gaining traction now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, mid-year for all health workers? That's ambitious. I remember, um, there were definitely some naysayers early on, but it seems to be really gaining traction now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And despite meeting with its share of naysayers, the program has continued to attract more governments, economic policymakers, and vaccine manufacturers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, absolutely. I mean, it's the only viable global solution, really. We can't just vaccinate some countries, you know? The virus doesn't care about borders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. I mean, it's the only viable global solution, really. We can't just vaccinate some countries, you know? The virus doesn't care about borders.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These participants are signing on because they recognize that COVAX is the only viable global solution to the COVID-19 crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And that brings up the whole, uh, vaccine nationalism issue, right? Where countries are making these bilateral deals, sometimes buying way more than they even need.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that brings up the whole, uh, vaccine nationalism issue, right? Where countries are making these bilateral deals, sometimes buying way more than they even need.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vaccine nationalism is precisely the problem that COVAX was created to solve. ... Unfortunately, we are already seeing some governments buy far more doses than they need, adding to the pressure on global supply during this critical initial phase.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. It's like, uh, we saw this with H1N1 back in 2009, where rich countries just hoarded the supply. COVAX was specifically designed to prevent that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. It's like, uh, we saw this with H one N one back in two thousand nine, where rich countries just hoarded the supply. C O V A X was specifically designed to prevent that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In tackling COVID-19, we must avoid a repeat of 2009, when a small number of rich countries bought up most of global supply of H1N1 flu vaccine, leaving the rest of the world with none. Vaccine nationalism is precisely the problem that COVAX was created to solve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And we're seeing it again now, aren't we? Some governments are buying far more doses than they need, which, um, it just strains the global supply.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And we're seeing it again now, aren't we? Some governments are buying far more doses than they need, which, um, it just strains the global supply.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unfortunately, we are already seeing some governments buy far more doses than they need, adding to the pressure on global supply during this critical initial phase.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but the good news is, like, if they do end up with a surplus, they can donate it through the Gavi/COVAX AMC. That's the mechanism for getting it to low and middle-income countries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but the good news is, like, if they do end up with a surplus, they can donate it through the Gavi slash C O V A X A M C. That's the mechanism for getting it to low and middle-income countries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best way to ensure that they are is for donor governments to go through the Gavi/COVAX Advance Market Commitment (AMC) mechanism, which was created to ensure that COVID-19 vaccines are made available to people living in the worlds 92 low- and middle-income countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which means manufacturers need to, you know, really step up too and make their vaccines available and affordable to COVAX. It's a huge ask.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means manufacturers need to, you know, really step up too and make their vaccines available and affordable to C O V A X. It's a huge ask.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All manufacturers must step up and make their vaccines available and affordable to COVAX, so that there can be a timely global rollout.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They do, and they've actually secured about a billion doses already for those 92 countries. And, uh, funding-wise, they needed quite a bit â€“ $5 billion for this year alone, after $2 billion last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They do, and they've actually secured about a billion doses already for those ninety two countries. And, uh, funding-wise, they needed quite a bit - five billion dollars for this year alone, after two billion dollars last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, COVAX has secured around one billion doses for people in these countries... But the program needed an additional $5 billion for 2021, and in December, the United States allocated $4 billion for Gavi in its second COVID-19 relief package.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw the US, like, allocated $400 million, which is a good start, but obviously, um, more is needed to finish the job.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw the U S, like, allocated four hundred million dollars, which is a good start, but obviously, um, more is needed to finish the job.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the program needed an additional $5 billion for 2021, and in December, the United States allocated $4 billion for Gavi in its second COVID-19 relief package.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. I mean, it's truly remarkable how far we've come. We're at a critical point, and COVAX really is our best shot at getting back to, uh, you know, some kind of normal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. I mean, it's truly remarkable how far we've come. We're at a critical point, and C O V A X really is our best shot at getting back to, uh, you know, some kind of normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For everyone, not just some of us. Fingers crossed for that continued solidarity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For everyone, not just some of us. Fingers crossed for that continued solidarity.
